parameters.description: A limit on the number of objects to be returned. Limit can range between 1 and 100, and the default is 20.
parameters.name: limit

parameters.description: Sort order by the `created_at` timestamp of the objects. `asc` for ascending order and `desc` for descending order.
parameters.name: order

parameters.description: A cursor for use in pagination. `after` is an object ID that defines your place in the list. For instance, if you make a list request and receive 100 objects, ending with obj_foo, your subsequent call can include after=obj_foo in order to fetch the next page of the list.
parameters.name: after

created_at.description: Unix timestamp (in seconds) when the container was created.

expires_after.description:
The container will expire after this time period.
The anchor is the reference point for the expiration.
The minutes is the number of minutes after the anchor before the container expires.

anchor.description: The reference point for the expiration.

minutes.description: The number of minutes after the anchor before the container expires.

status.description: Status of the container (e.g., active, deleted).

first_id.description: The ID of the first container in the list.

has_more.description: Whether there are more containers available.

last_id.description: The ID of the last container in the list.

object.description: The type of object returned, must be 'list'.
